name: Islamic Center of Southern California
mission: The Islamic Center is more than a place of worship. We are a community united in pursuing spiritual growth, compassion, and knowledge. Our mission is to provide a welcoming and inclusive environment where people can come together to connect, learn, and give back.
zakatClaimEvidence: The Islamic Center of Southern California (ICSC) explicitly mentions "Zakat & Sadaqah – Fulfill your religious obligations and assist those in need within our community" under its 'Ways to Give' section. Furthermore, it has a dedicated 'Zakat Program' that "offers crucial support including $15 food coupons, rental assistance, and utility assistance to help alleviate immediate needs". The ICSC's donation page also lists "Zakat al-Fitr" and "Zakat al-Mal" as specific donation categories. (Source: https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQEcbVWaxZpWjtyTy3jiV-1Vr_Lsq_ady9PujulHZYifVGezgk7GN3_arJjtKi2PZ-5JA47WELsJs_Mgs_pI_CXEE1jdpwsf5WDtPjREJhkd2VRo23SbtiHpv7B0)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Limited match due to weaker results and/or higher uncertainty; review methodology details before deciding.

components.evidence: Accepts zakat (+2); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Islamic identity (+1); Asnaf: fi_sabilillah (+5)
components.improvement_suggestion: Add a dedicated zakat page or program and highlight humanitarian dimensions of your work
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

alignment.rationale: Alignment 29/50: MEDIUM Muslim donor fit, religious cultural cause area

components.improvement_suggestion: Track and report beneficiary counts to enable cost analysis
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: Document why reserves above your policy target are intentional (e.g., restrictions, volatility, planned commitments) and define deployment triggers.
components.name: Financial Health

components.improvement_suggestion: Seek external evaluation or track outcomes for 3+ years
components.name: Evidence & Outcomes

components.improvement_suggestion: Document a clear theory of change with causal pathway
components.name: Theory of Change

risks.risk_summary: Key concern: Program expense ratio critically low: 50%

risks.description: No outcome measurement or metrics tracking

score_details.score_summary: Islamic Center of Southern California shows good alignment and limited impact, with zakat compliance (significant risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: The Islamic Center of Southern California (ICSC) explicitly mentions "Zakat & Sadaqah – Fulfill your religious obligations and assist those in need within our community" under its 'Ways to Give' section. Furthermore, it has a dedicated 'Zakat Program' that "offers crucial support including $15 food coupons, rental assistance, and utility assistance to help alleviate immediate needs". The ICSC's donation page also lists "Zakat al-Fitr" and "Zakat al-Mal" as specific donation categories. (Source: https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQEcbVWaxZpWjtyTy3jiV-1Vr_Lsq_ady9PujulHZYifVGezgk7GN3_arJjtKi2PZ-5JA47WELsJs_Mgs_pI_CXEE1jdpwsf5WDtPjREJhkd2VRo23SbtiHpv7B0)

all_citations.claim: The organization reports 17.2 months of working capital and a fundraising efficiency of $0.00 per $1 raised.
The center reported total revenue of $2,134,893 and a program expense ratio of 49.6%.
The Islamic Center of Southern California provides programs including a Food Pantry, Sunday School, and Funeral Services.
The organization offers various donation options and is identified as Zakat-eligible.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a 37/100 due to strong financial liquidity and fundraising efficiency, balanced against a lower program expense ratio and limited external data for impact verification.
areas_for_improvement: The program expense ratio of 49.6% suggests that less than half of total expenses are directed toward primary programs [2].
Limited third-party data availability results in a low data confidence rating for impact assessment [1].

dimension_explanations.alignment: With a score of 29/50, the organization shows medium donor fit as a Zakat-eligible institution serving religious and cultural needs, though its track record is primarily documented through internal reporting [1][4].
dimension_explanations.impact: The center focuses on capacity building through its food pantry and educational programs, though its impact score of 15/50 reflects a lack of specific cost-per-beneficiary data and a program expense ratio of 49.6% [1][2][3].

baseline_narrative.headline: The Islamic Center of Southern California serves as an independent religious and social hub dedicated to practicing and sharing Islamic values in the United States.
strengths: Maintains a robust liquidity position with 17.2 months of working capital available for operations [1].
High fundraising efficiency with a reported cost of $0.00 per $1 raised [1].
Offers diverse community programming including a food pantry, Sunday school, and funeral services [3].
baseline_narrative.summary: Based in Los Angeles, the organization operates as an independent entity providing essential religious, educational, and social services to the local community [1][3]. In the 2023 fiscal year, the center reported a total revenue of $2,134,893 to support its diverse mission-driven activities [2].
